Cirrhosis is the end point of a variety of chronic liver diseases and can lead to such complications as ascites, variceal bleeding, and hepatic encephalopathy. These complications contribute to cirrhosis being the 12th leading cause of death in the United States.
1 Cirrhosis is also the primary risk factor for hepatocellular carcinoma (HCC), which is increasing in incidence and associated mortality.
